bibl.title: Sappho and the Mythopoetics of the Domestic.
The Newest Sappho: P. Sapph. Obbink and P. GC inv. 105, Frs. 1-4 = Studies in Archaic and Classical Greek Song. 2

bibl.note: P. Coll. privées: P. Green Inv. 105 (= M.-P.3 1445.01; LDAB 341738) + P. Coll. privées [P. Sapph. Obbink] (= M.-P.3 1445.02; LDAB 341738). - To better understand the Brothers Song, one should contextualize the first-person speaker's discourse about her brothers within a broader literary tradition and, even more specifically, with sisterly logoi about and to brothers.
bibl.seg: Anastasia-Erasmia Peponi, Sappho and the Mythopoetics of the Domestic.

Anton Bierl & André Lardinois (edd.), The Newest Sappho: P. Sapph. Obbink and P. GC inv. 105, Frs. 1-4 = Studies in Archaic and Classical Greek Song. 2 = Mnemosyne. Supplements. 392 (Leiden - Boston, 2016) pp. 225-237, 1 fig.

P. Coll. privées: P. Green Inv. 105 (= M.-P.3 1445.01; LDAB 341738) + P. Coll. privées [P. Sapph. Obbink] (= M.-P.3 1445.02; LDAB 341738). - To better understand the Brothers Song, one should contextualize the first-person speaker's discourse about her brothers within a broader literary tradition and, even more specifically, with sisterly logoi about and to brothers.
